info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 2:14PM PDT until August 01 at 3:45PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE MORONGO BASIN... At 214 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen per radar estimates and local officials have reported the beginning of flood impacts in the area. Significant heavy rainfall has already occurred south of State Route 62 as well as over it. Another round of similar rainfall rates is expected in the same areas and the risk for further flash flooding is increasing. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and local emergency management. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and both secondary and primary roadways. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Yucca Valley, Joshua Tree Lake Campground and Joshua Tree and the State Route 62 corridor west of Twentynine Palms. Flooding is likely occurring along and south of State Route 62 between Sunfair and Lear Ave based on where the heaviest rainfall has occurred. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles so be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
